sen.j: 二条通（にじょうどおり）は京都市の主要な東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Nijo-dori Street is one of the major east-west running streets in Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Nijo-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Nijo-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 平安京の二条大路にあたる。
sen.e: It corresponds to the Nijo-oji Street in Heiankyo.
It corresponds to the Nijo-oji Street in Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Nijo-oji Street in Heian-kyo.

sen.j: 平安京大内裏の南を東西に走り、朱雀大路に次ぐ広い通りであった。
sen.e: Running east and west along the southern edge of Dai-dairi (place of the Imperial Palace and government offices), Nijo-oji was widest next to Suzakuoji broad avenue.
Running east and west along the southern edge of Dai-dairi (the site of the Imperial Palace and government offices), Nijo-oji was widest next to Suzakuoji Broad Avenue.
Running east and west along the southern edge of Dai-dairi (the site of the Imperial Palace and government offices), Nijo-oji was widest next to Suzakuoji Broad Avenue.

sen.j: 東は白川通から西は二条城に面する堀川通まで延びているが、千本通から西に旧二条通があり、朱雀二条商店街振興組合と称する商店街がある。
sen.e: The Nijo-dori stretches from the Shirakawa-dori Street in the east to Nijo Castle, which faces the Horikawa-dori Street. The former Nijo-dori continues west from the Sembon-dori Street and includes a Shopping Street of Suzaku Nijo Shopping District Promotion Ａｓｓｏｃｉａｔｉｏｎ.

The Nijo-dori stretches from Shirakawa-dori Street in the east to Nijo Castle, which faces Horikawa-dori Street; the former Nijo-dori continues west from the Sembon-dori Street and includes the shopping street of the Suzaku Nijo Shopping District Promotion Ａｓｓｏｃｉａｔｉｏｎ.

Nijo-dori Street stretches from Shirakawa-dori Street in the east to Nijo Castle in the west, which faces Horikawa-dori Street; the former Nijo-dori Street continues west from the Senbon-dori Street and includes the shopping street of the Suzaku Nijo Shopping District Promotion Association.
sen.cmt: Street, in the west 追加 二バイト文字修正

sen.j: 東端の左京区岡崎は六勝寺の跡地である。
sen.e: At the east end, in Okazaki, Sakyo Ward, Rikusho-ji Temple was once located.
Rikusho-ji Temple was once located at the east end, in Okazaki, Sakyo ward.
Rikusho-ji Temple was once located at the east end, in Okazaki, Sakyo ward.

sen.j: ここには京都会館、京都市美術館、京都国立近代美術館、京都市動物園など、やや北に位置する平安神宮とともに明治以降に作られた文化施設が並ぶ。
sen.e: Now located are cultural facilities built in and after the Meiji era, such as Kyoto Kaiakn (hall), Kyoto Municipal Museum of Art, the National Museum of Modern Art, Kyoto, Kyoto City Zoo and Heian Jingu, though Heian Jigu is a little north of the street.

Today there are cultural facilities built in and after the Meiji era, such as Kyoto Kaiakn (hall), Kyoto Municipal Museum of Art, the National Museum of Modern Art, Kyoto, Kyoto City Zoo and Heian Jingu, though Heian Jigu is a little north of the street.

Today there are cultural facilities built in and after the Meiji period, such as Kyoto Kaikan Hall; the Kyoto Municipal Museum of Art; the National Museum of Modern Art, Kyoto; and Kyoto City Zoo, together with Heian Jingu Shrine, which is located a little north of the street.
sen.cmt: Kyoto Kaikan Hall としました。 era→ period、 Heian Jingu Shrine に修正

sen.j: 寺町通の南東角には、小説「檸檬 (小説)」で知られる梶井基次郎が、レモンを買い求めた果物屋が現存する。
sen.e: At the corner with the Teramachi-dori Street, there remains a fruit shop that Motojiro KAJII, well known novelist for his work titled "Remon (Lemon)," visited to buy lemons.
At the corner with Teramachi-dori Street, there is a fruit shop that Motojiro KAJII, well known novelist for his work titled "Remon (Lemon)," visited in order to buy lemons.
At the southeast corner with Teramachi-dori Street, there is a fruit shop that Motojiro KAJII, a novelist known for his work titled 'Remon (Lemon),' visited in order to buy lemons.

sen.j: 島津製作所創業記念館
